thread.title: UTEP Miners Soccer team confident in final stretch
thread.title_full: UTEP Miners Soccer team confident in final stretch

title: UTEP Miners Soccer team confident in final stretch
text:
UTEP Miners Soccer team confident in final stretch POSTED: 06:20 PM MDT Oct 19, 2015 UPDATED: 06:40 PM MDT Oct 19, 2015 UTEP Soccer team confident in final stretch EL PASO, Texas - 
The UTEP Miners soccer team has 3 games left in the regular season, and all of those matchups are key conference matchups and at home. 
Head Coach Kevin Cross has led the Miners to a solid 10-5-2 record before the final stretch of the season. Cross said he thinks this team is capable of a championship and these last 3 games will show what this team is made of. 
"We think we are good enough to compete for a championship," Cross said. "We have shown that this year. And even in our losses, if we had a little luck on our side we could have won. We can beat anyone on any given day." 
The Miners are still far from a championship, but if they continue the play they have shown all season long, Coach Cross's comments are not hard to believe. 
The Lady Miners wrap up the season hosting Charlotte, Old Dominion and finally Middle Tennessee. Recommended
